blog.description: Hi there, I’m Rachel and I pretend to be good at writing on here (Masterlist) so I can avoid writing actual academic things (currently: my entire dissertation) for uni. Feel free to message me a request, or prompt or just for a chat. Love ya xox Masterlist

summary: One Night // Tony Stark
title: One Night // Tony Stark
body:
Have a badly written, tiny drabble. 

Pairing: Tony Stark x reader

Words: ~750

Masterlist

Being a high school teacher was always interesting. You never knew who was going to through a chair at you, who was going to set the classroom on fire or try and snort one of the chemicals you had them using. This, however, was totally out of range in terms of predicted events.

Last night, you and your old college friends decided to go out and celebrate your friend’s birthday. Your plan was to go out, have one or two drinks, and get home at a reasonable time as you still had classes to teach before the parent-teacher conference the next day.  

However, the drinks didn’t seem to stop, each bar seeming dark and busier than the last, moods changing from light and funny to dark and sultry. Somehow, you’d gotten into one of the more exclusive clubs in New York, and the night took a bit of turn. You’d lost everyone you arrived with, dancing your way through the crowd looking for someone, anyone you knew.  

You found someone, just not someone you knew. Yet.

Stumbling into your apartment, your new friend attached to your neck. You struggled to make it to your bed using only touch, the lips on yours and hands all over your skin distracting you to no end.  

The night was a blur, many highs and loud moans before the stranger disappearing home, you barely acknowledging his excuse before passing out for what was left of the night.  

The next morning you evaluated the damage before deciding a collared shirt would have to do in order to cover the hickey’s scattered across your collar bones. Rushing into work, you hoped no one would notice the hangover ruining your mood or your nearly late arrival.  

Thankfully none of your students noticed anything, although they never could tell when you were hungover. A few of your close friends at work had glimpsed the decorations given to you whilst you were making coffee, adding a few sarcastic comments to your breaks.  

By the time the parent-teacher conference began, you were desperately chugging water and counting down to your next allowance of painkillers, the hangover threatening to send you home.  

You loved teaching; you loved all the kids. The one thing you hated more than anything though, was the parents. They all thought their child was the best, even when they were total idiotic brats.  

With each parent you spoke to, your mood became harder and harder to cover up, and things were about to go from bad to worse.

“Hi I’m Miss Y/L/N, I’m Peters -” You froze as you recognised the man in front of you.

“Well this is awkward.”

“Umm, you’re Peter’s dad?”

“Pretty much.”

“Yeah this is awkward.”

“I’m just gonna clear the air so we can move on. Hey, we hooked up last night and it turns out you are my child’s teacher. That’s super awkward but I think we should do the professional thing now and then go get a drink afterwards.”

“Peters great, except that he doesn’t always turn up. I have more parents but I finish at nine.” You blurted out, getting to the point as quickly as possible

“I’ll be here. Maybe we can talk about helping Peter more then. I’m Tony by the way” Your mystery man winked before heading back to Peter who had planted himself in the far corner of the room.  

The rest of the night was a blur, the parents seemingly more tolerable than before, although you put that down to excitement.

Just as he promised, Tony was waiting, having dropped Peter back home.

You spent several hours, walking, talking – about both yourselves and Peter – and getting to know the other. For a night out fling, the connection you felt was more than you could understand.  

Every night for the rest of the week, Tony took you somewhere different, wooing you a little more each time. You had never felt a connection like this before. By the time Friday came around you couldn’t help but melt into him and agree when he invited you back with him

Waking up on Saturday morning, Tony grabbed your hand on the way to the kitchen. Although as he turned the corner you heard a faint “Uh oh.”

“MISS Y/L/N?!”  

“MR STARK?!”  

“Peter, now please calm down.”

“SHE’S MY TEACHER”

It was going to be a long school term.  

This is so short im so sorry pls dont hate me.

blog.name: i-love-tony-stark-3000
blog.title: MCU Lord and Saviour Tony Stark ⎊
blog.description: An Iron Man fan in mourning. Thank you, my darling. We'll all take care of Morgan for you. I love you 3000.

summary: On the 29th of May, I will be willingly breaking my diet by eating a cheeseburger in honour of the birth date of the MCU’s...
body:
On the 29th of May, I will be willingly breaking my diet by eating a cheeseburger in honour of the birth date of the MCU’s indisputable Lord and Saviour, Anthony Edward Stark.

The ceremonial consumption of the cheeseburger will be followed by the ritual in which I lock myself in my room, blast AC/DC and proceed to sob for three hours over what could have been.

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

summary: thinking makes it so
title: thinking makes it so
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2ZNNfNl

by sneck

MAJOR SPOILERS FOR ENDGAME!

 

These were the facts of time travel.

You couldn’t change your own timeline without fracturing the flow of time and creating alternate realities.

You could, however, surgically alter one thing, some unknown fact that wouldn’t affect anything else. Like planting a seed in the past that wouldn’t grow until the present.

Enter Loki.

Words: 6409, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Thor (Movies), Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: Gen
  • Characters: Loki (Marvel), Thor (Marvel), Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Tony Stark, Clint Barton, Nebula (Marvel), Avengers Team (MCU), Steve Rogers, Misc. Avengers, Asgardians, Eir (Marvel), Stephen Strange, Wong (Marvel), Thanos
  • Relationships: Loki & Thor (Marvel), Loki & Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Avengers: Infinity War Part 1 (Movie) Spoilers, Avengers: Endgame (Movie) Spoilers, Not Avengers: Endgame (Movie) Compliant, Endgame Fix-It, Loki Redemption, Infinity Stones, Loki Whump, Time Travel


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2ZNNfNl

summary: Anthony Stark - Avengers: Endgame
title: Anthony Stark - Avengers: Endgame
body:
I gotta post about this.

That scene where Tony is ripping into any and everyone had to be one of the most satisfying things to watch. It was perfectly sad, yet vindicating. Tony finally got to say everything he - otherwise would have held in or pushed to the back-burner because they had to move on. There really were more pressing matters at hand.

The timing of that scene helped to show how broken, tired, and delirious Tony had become after having all that time on the ship to stew over his thoughts (2 people can only stand so much of each other for consecutive days at a time). If Tony had been in his right mind, he wouldn’t have blown up like that. And the team knew that, as well.

All of their reactions and expressions reflected empathy and sorrow. They all knew how he felt, except they were glad to see him when the opposite party was not. The mood-maker of the team had run out of fuel. He’d lost all hope and put himself at fault for their circumstances. His outward blame of the others was an attempt of trying to convince himself that all this wasn’t just because of him. “If I had just made the damn shield around the world, this all would have never happened.” That was Tony’s mindset in that low point.

But with rest and time, he realized there was really nothing any of them could have done to truly prevent Thanos from coming. There was no way to predict how he would have come. So with what little hope was left in his shattered heart, Tony strengthened his resolve and settled down to raise a family. And he cherished it with all his heart.

After Infinity War, Tony’s fear of the unknown had become far more exemplified. If it hadn’t been for the understanding of his teammates, during that outburst, I don’t think Endgame would have ever happened. Tony would have flat out refused to associate with them. But no one rose to the bait. There wasn’t a shouting match between him and anyone else - just Tony venting, for all intents and purposes. There was still love there; they were still a family. They argued, they made up, they comforted. That’s just how a family rolls.

After Tony gave Rhodey his “legs” back so many years ago, Rhodey was there to pick him up in his lowest moment. Steve and Nat understood Tony’s terror of losing the ones he loved and respectively backed off, when he made his decision clear. Even after the biggest scare of her life, Pepper encouraged Tony to take care of his sanity over her own fears (”Will you be able to rest?).

This movie had some faults, yeah, but scenes like this truly make up for it. I seriously love this franchise. Lol I will definitely be going to see this again.

summary: Call me foolish, but I'm still hoping Tony isn't actually dead. I'm still hoping we see him in FFH, at the end of the movie....
body: Call me foolish, but I’m still hoping Tony isn’t actually dead. I’m still hoping we see him in FFH, at the end of the movie. Peter seems depressed in the trailers, which I link to Tony’s death, but Happy is, well… Happy? So I’m kinda hoping, I don’t know, that at the end of the movie Happy takes Peter to a remote, secret house to lighten his mood, and Tony’s there, looking after Morgan, being the stay at home dad he deserved to be while Pepper runs the Stark company by day. No one knows he’s alive but his closest circle of friends and family. I know, I know, we’ve seen a funeral but I can’t help but hope. Anything to fix the pain.

summary: I love you 3000...
title: I love you 3000...
body:
The total runtime of all the marvel movies in the mcu is approx. 2,868 minutes, which is suspiciously close to 3000.

“Not that’s it’s a competition, but the last time I checked, you were somewhere in the 600-900 range.”

The total runtime of all movies in the dceu is 711 minutes.
